# Readings


As part of the course, there are several articles, papers and technical reports that you will need to read during the semester. Most of the articles themselves are accessible through the University of Minnesota library website (http://www.lib.umn.edu). In order to access the full text of some of the articles, you will need to log in using your University x500 username and password. More detailed information, including references or links to specific readings, are given below.


## Welcome to EPsy 8251 {#welcome}

**Required**

- Download and read through the [course syllabus](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/zief0002/miniature-garbanzo/main/syllabus/f22-8251-syllabus.pdf)
- Read [Preface for Statistical Modeling and Computation for Educational Scientists](https://zief0002.github.io/modeling/preface.html#preface) [*Computational Toolkit*]

## Introduction to R and RStudio {#rstudio}

**Required**


- Download and install the most recent versions of [R (version 4.2.1; *Funny Looking Kid*)](https://www.r-project.org/) and [RStudio Desktop (version 2022.07.1)](https://www.rstudio.com/) on your computer. See [R and RStudio Installation and Setup](https://zief0002.github.io/toolkit-quarto/02-r-and-rstudio-installation.html) for help.

Read the following:

- [Getting Started with R](https://zief0002.github.io/toolkit-quarto/03-getting-started-with-r.html) [*Computational Toolkit*]
- [Data Structures in R](https://zief0002.github.io/toolkit-quarto/04-data-structures-in-r.html) [*Computational Toolkit*]


**Additional Resources**

- [RStudio Cheatsheets](https://www.rstudio.com/resources/cheatsheets/)
